forum.name: Barriers to Completion
forum.intro:
A quote on pages 130-131 of the NRC report, Improving Adult Literacy Instruction, reads as follows: “Although lack of persistence is often discussed solely in psychological or dispositional terms, such as being intrinsically motivated or self-regulated, most contemporary researchers of motivation recognize the power of the learner’s environment—instructional interactions and structures, relationships, and broader social and cultural experience—to affect motivation, engagement, and goal attainment.”

Think about students who have dropped out—or those who are at risk of dropping out—of your adult education classes—and think about the learning environment in your classes.

  • Can you identify their reasons for dropping out as related to situational, institutional, or dispositional barriers, as defined in the video Enhancing Lerner Persistence? 
  • Which of these barriers do you think is the most difficult for adult education students to overcome? 
  • Did you find ways to help your students overcome any of these barriers? 
  • How might the classroom climate and the quality of adult education instruction provided affect learner persistence? 
  • Do you think that incorporating SCL principles into instruction might overcome some of these barriers? If so, how?

Click below on "Add a new discussion topic" to add your thoughts on the above questions to the discussion forum.
